intro: Psychotria aquatilis, commonly known as the water psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in wet, lowland areas near rivers and swamps. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Psychotria aquatilis is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ornamental value.
